name: Terraform
description: Moda should be capturing infrastructure assets in committed code (why it is important). Current thinking is that it is superior to CloudFormation for the following reasons:

name: <li>Terraform is multi-service. This does not mean that the same Terraform resource can be deployed indiscriminately across different clouds. But it does mean that resources across multiple cloud providers (or any provider
ring: really) can be captured in Terraform - and thus be captured in the same workflow

name: <li>Terraform uses the provider's APIs. As a result
ring: Terraform - which can model anything available via the API - will always be ahead of CloudFormation in supported resources.

name: CloudFormation
description:
Moda should be capturing infrastructure assets in committed code (why it is important). CloudFormation is the AWS-native way to do IaC. Please see commentary on Terraform for reasons why CloudFormation is not recommended.

"
